page.title: 05A MENDIP ARABLE FARM 2
page.content: The farmer at Priddy Hill Farm used to farm on lower land in Wiltshire. He reports that the soil on Mendip is more productive despite being stony but snow can lead to access problems n Winter and mist and fog are frequent hazards. The farmer tries to grow a variety of crops and avoids monoculture. Seed is expensive and the farmer is experimenting to find varieties of wheat and barley which enjoy the conditions of the plateau; old varieties are deliberately pursued as well as new{hybrids.}Although the farmer has only farmed the area for a short time he obviously enjoys his work and understands the need for careful management. He is keen to experiment but is also aware of the need to conserve{soil fertility.}
